properties.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 3 at 4:18AM MST until February 4 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
properties.description:
* WHAT...For both of the advisories, north winds 25 to 35 mph with
gusts up to 50 mph are expected.

* WHERE...Western portion of Joshua Tree National Park.

* WHEN...For the first Wind Advisory, until 4 PM PST this
afternoon. For the second Wind Advisory, from 7 AM to 7 PM PST
Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger
vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light,
unsecured objects may become airborne. Minor tree damage
possible.
properties.instruction:
A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between
30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and
58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially
for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert
areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under
a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra
caution.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 7 PM PST TUESDAY
